result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavana R Marx was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Jail (Straight Time).
Consecutive to: Any Other Sentence.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
DNA Sample to be provided, if not yet previously done.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  45 Days Jail (Straight Time) STAYED; to be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without Huber (Non  Working Hours).

Arraignment on May 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Lavana R Marx in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Nathan Smidt from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
